info.title: NPO Frontend API
info.description: Exposes the data of POMS (mediaobject, schedule information and subtitles), and the pages publisher (CMS content plus links to media)Provided examples are automatically generated and may not be accurate. You may find manually maintained examples of search forms on github

tags.name: subtitles
tags.description: This returns the available subtitles"  (tt888, webvtt and srt are supported).

get.description:
Retrieve all media changes since a certain update sequence.
By submitting an optional profile argument only changes for this argument are emitted. For certain parameters this callcan take very long and/or return very much data. Be prepared to handle that gracefully.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Optimize media result for these returned properties

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Since which revision to stream. This parameter is ignored and set to 0 if at that point the profile did not exist. This parameter will be deprecated.

parameters.name: publishedSince
parameters.description: Since which published date to stream. This parameter is ignored if at that point the profile did not exist (unless you use checkProfile=false). ISO_8601 is recognized, and also millis since EPOCH. You might optionally also add ,<mid> which deals with the case that several changes happened at exactly (to millisecond precision) the same time.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum number of items returned. Usefull for human inspection with a browser. Look out with this value if the since parameter is before the profile existed, or consider checkProfile=false

parameters.name: checkProfile
parameters.description: If the definition for a profile changes, and you requests changes from before this change, this call may implicitly return more requests to make sure that you receive all changes that should be relevant for you. In many cases this may result in returning very many results in such caches. The idea is that this could be set tot false to skip checking for profile changes altogether, and just evaluate the currently defined profile. If you use a max argument, then it may be advisable to use 'false' for this attribute.

parameters.name: deletes
parameters.description: Normally for every object not in the profile a deleted object is issued. This can be set to EXCLUDE to avoid that. You can also set it to ID_ONLY, to include the deletes but with only the id (which should suffice to issue a delete to the pages publisher)

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description:
The feed can be followed with a placeholder object ('the tail'), which purpose is to indicate how fow the
changes feed now is handled. Its values can be used in the next call. Default it only is returned if there
would otherwise be no results. Best is to use 'ALWAYS'.

parameters.name: reasonFilter
parameters.description: Skip a change if every reason matches this regular expression (re2 implementation). This feature is experimental. You always have to specify this parameter if you want to see reasons. The empty string in that respect is special, it will cause that reasons are returned (unless the since value is too far in the past), but no server side filtering will be done. Note that no reason filtering or returning will be done if the since value is too far in the past.

parameters.name: partyId
parameters.description: topspin partyId

post.description: This is like the list call. It does however support filtering by a form (though it is not actually a search). There is no bound on the value of 'max'. It can only give back JSON. The target of this call is to facilitate use cases in which you need to fetch very, very much (as e.g. the generation of a site map). Offset is supported, but using it large values will be inefficient. The idea is that you read the resulting json streamingly.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip this many results first. This parameter may be dropped or limited to small values in future version

get.description: Retrieve a profile by its name and an optional point in time. Note: This call cannot return JSON, only XML. It therefore probably doesn't work in the swagger interface.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Optional timestamp in millis from 1970

parameters.name: guideDay
parameters.description: Guide day in simple ISO8601 format, e.g. 2014-02-27

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start time in full ISO8601 format, e.g. 2014-02-27T07:06:00Z

parameters.name: stop
parameters.description: Stop time in full ISO8601 format, e.g. 2014-02-28T22:06:00Z

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Optimize media result for these returned properties

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Optimize media result for these returned properties
